intro: Gastrolobium villosum, commonly known as the silky wattle, is a shrub native to Australia. It is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and it has the ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is cultivated in gardens and used in land rehabilitation projects.
